description:
The use of convalescent serum is one of the few methods available to combat Ebola. Unfortunately the method has had little to no successful trials. More tests need to be done in nonhuman primates to confirm the effectiveness and safety of this serum. Using blood transfusions has met moderate success in the past but the vast differences in survivors and patients makes the true worth of this treatment hard to see for certain. With further trials and research it could be a potentially important treatment but that has yet to be seen. Before we pour money into an idea it should be properly tested and proven to ensure we dont waste the time of our healthcare workers.
http://news.sciencemag.org/africa/2014/08/who-ponders-treating-ebola-infected-people-blood-survivors
summary: The convalescent serum has not been fully tested and may not be affective.
title: The use of Convalescent serum to treat Ebola
